I couldn't believe i made it up until the end. I couldn't completely say that it bores me, but the thing is, i kept thinking how the story will end but im disappointed because the ending was not clear. I dunno if there will be a second season for this anime but it really pisses me off that it was left at that kind of ending. I mean, this is super reversed harem (11 guys all have fallen inlove with one girl) but at least they could have an ending like she made it clear to all the guys that she will not be inany relationship in any of them, however, it turns out that they refused to believe-- they remain persistent. And left at the last moment where in the heroine kept hoping that she will be a real siblings to them. And she havent talked to all of them at all!

I haven't watched any shoujo/ reverse harem anime for quite a while, so perhaps that has something to do with why Brothers Conflict (BC) feels so fresh and exciting, but I really believe that even if I hadn't had a break from the genre, I would still have held the same opinions as I did now and found it truly enjoyable.
Story: 7/10
Given that there are 13 "potential" male characters in this anime, I presumed that it was based on an otome game, which indeed it was. Bearing this in mind, I think that, although there wasn't so much of an exciting plot in terms ofanything outside of Ema's relationship with each brother and the various conflicts that arose, the anime was actually well woven together in a coherent way. I've read that other people find the lack of depth due to the jumping between brothers a little disappointing, which I can agree with.  However, the last episode gave what appeared to be strong hints at another season, so I'm hoping that in that case, the obvious lack of focus on certain characters will be remedied and give a more well-rounded and complete feeling to the series. As far as otome-to-anime adaptions go, this is one of the better ones that I've seen.


Art : 9/10


Art style preferences are subjective, however I for one absolutely adored the art in BC. The apartment is an example of how beautiful not only the characters are, but the level of attention to detail that went into every other aspect as far as I could see. Colourful but not obnoxiously so; a complete pleasure to my eyes. I may even go as far to say that even if the anime itself had bored me, I may have persevered simply for the gorgeous art.


Sound: 7/10


The first time I heard the OP I wasn't too fond of it; it seems jarring and just not that enjoyable. However, as the series progressed and as I heard it again and again, it started to grow on me. By the time I'd reached episode 6 or 7, I loved it. I think that it suits the anime perfectly; happy, charged, carefree and it never failed to get me genuinely excited for the episode to begin. I'm never normally one who pays much attention to the background music in animes, however for once there were a few pieces that I actively appreciated at the time, fitting the scene and enhancing the mood. The soundtrack isn't one of the greatest in the world, but it is good.


Character: 8/10


As mentioned before, there is a lack of depth of development with a lot of characters, and any development that does happen occurs quite quickly given  the 12-episode run. However I've given BC an 8/10 on this simply for the sheer volume of characters that they included, and the diversity within them. As an otome game, it makes sense to create as many character types to appeal to as wide of an audience as possible, but this can sometimes be lost in the transition to an anime, where some characters get thrown under the bus, so to speak. In this case, however, each brother was distinct and seperate in both appearance and personality, and within a few episodes, the names of the vast majority had stuck and by the end I genuinely cared about each and every one, even the ones that we had only gotten a brief flavour of. Yes, some of the standard shoujo tropes are thrown in, but in refreshing combinations so they don't just feel like 13 cookie-cuttered replicas of every other male love interest in history.


The main character herself was quite passive until the very end (necessary to facilitate what I assume are multiple CG references from the game from multiple men), but wasn't a pushover or a crybaby - something which seems to plague the genre. Initially she cannot tell when she is being teased, but over time she ADAPTS and fits in with the dynamic of the other characters. Had she had a bit more... je ne sais quoi, she could have been better, but as far as otome protagonists go, at least she has a name, eyes and somewhat of a personality!


I stayed up until 5am to finish marathoning this.  I had only intended to find a new anime, watch a couple of episodes to get a feel of it and then go to bed. But I ended up being too enthralled to stop and I'm now full of regret for staying up so late, but not for spending that time watching this anime. 


If you enjoy reverse harems and don't mind a primarily character-focused story rather than an over-arching plot about mystery or magic or demons or anything, then I cannot recommend this enough.

So I just finished watching Brothers Conflict, I know many people really didn't enjoy the anime but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Often anime adaptions of otome games are regarded as poor and never really leave you feeling fully satisfied, Brothers Conflict can be argued to be the same, however it is definitely one of the better anime adaptions out there.
The story line was pretty standard, a young girl entering a house of brothers, soon to be chased by the majority of them. It may seem wrong in many peoples eyes but it doesn't mean it's not enjoyable. I liked how it wasn't just purely "romance"and managed to throw in some humor here and there. I haven't played the game so I can't compare on whether it was truthful to the game but I can still say that it was pretty good.


As for the characters I think it's up to your personal taste on whether you like them or not. Everyone has their preferences and with plenty of characters to choose from in BroCon you can't exactly say you didn't like at least one of them. The protagonist was slightly dull in some areas but when you have so many guys who are supposed to be your brothers chasing after you, I'd say she has every right to be like that from time to time.


I think the art in Brothers Conflict was something you can't shake your fist at. Although I can't say it was 100% perfect I can say that it was done very well. The colour's were vibrant and the characters were all unique in there own way. It was nice to look at and I'm sad that I'm not going to be able to get my weekly dose of it anymore.


Overall I gave Brothers Conflict an 8. It was light-hearted, humorous and quite cute. If you enjoy anime with this sort of genre and can get over the fact all the guys are meant to be her brothers (some people really do disagree with this, but I think it's something you have to get over-it's not like they are blood related), I'd definitely recommend watching the anime. If you are really unsure on whether you enjoy this sort of anime, don't watch it, it may put you off watching other anime's that are similar.

Ema had gained 13 brothers after the marriage of Ema father and The Asahina mother. Each character have their unique characteristic. Well as usual i have a few complained about the MC. As much as i love the progress for every episode i cant take it when the MC became a total slut. The MC is a gamer so that differ from others Reverse Harem anime. Since most Reverse Harem MC is usually lady like naive and ended up as like a slut. Ema however after many advances from her "Brothers" accept it and did not even struggle to move. Even after telling all her"brothers" that she just wants to be family she got affected by every move they made on her. Enjoying the pleasure given. Like looking at a plate full of delicacy. \n\n
Yes i had given this anime an overall 10 as i ignore the MC and frantically fan girl at the brother.

TL;dr: Another anime based off an otome that doesn't work. Characters are already in love and you never get much backstory of either side.
---------------
Story: The main girl moves into her new home and meets her new family. They are all her brothers and they just love her immediately, all trying to get her to get with them and competing with each other to get her =.= so each episode is just them fighting over her and kissing her. It's just like why? They act as if this is the only female they've ever interacted with...
Art: The art style to me was okay. Nothing super alluringto me. Their faces kinda weirded me out actually...\n\n
Sound: Wasn't that fond of the opening or ending. The ending has the characters from the show singing and well they aren't good >m

The idea that all 13 boys have fallen for one submissive girl is not ideal; however, I think it brings much need humor to the show. At first it is hard to grasp who is who for there are 13 of them and they are introduced so fast. Watching the show through separates the brothers because they all have very different personalities. 
Each episodes builds upon the last by allowing one brothers feeling to be continued while another is starching to form. The anticipation on which boy will go farther than the other to win her affection is great. In fact it is so greatthat one brother charts the progress. 


With her there, the brothers' interest have begun to broaden. She bring out the best for the family in the boy wanting to strive to be perfect for her. However, she also brings out rivalries as well. The anime is worth watching to see how they progress to obtain her love. 


The is one issue and that may just be me, but I did not know her real name. I do not think the brother used it and Julie, along with Louis, always used the nickname, Chi. I know it now, but I'm not sure it is specified in the anime.

Hi there 
Overall brothers conflict is a great anime in my opinion. It is about Ema ( the main charater )
That was an only child that gets " dragged " in to a family with her new 13 brothers. I liked the anime because the story line kept on going and has graeat quality. 
 The only problem was that she is a little to sensitive for me and doesn't really get that involved with her step-brothers 
If you like reverse Harlem you will like this anime and the art of it
By your fellow anime lover

I had a lot of fun watching this anime. It's totally unrealistic of all 13 brothers falling in love with the same women especially considering she is their new step sister but none the less I found it to be enjoyable.
 I loved the opening and ending themes as well as the variety of brothers. Their are so many of them but I felt that any guy or girl could love at least one of them XD However, the large cast of characters meant it became quite difficult to delve deep into all of them but all of them at some point shared amoment between the protagonist which was sweet. 


For me I felt weird that all these brothers somehow loved her in a romantic way so soon, it felt unrealistic but it was interesting to see the varies situations the boys would put her through and their really were some beautiful moments between the characters.


The third youngest of the bunch actually had genuine feelings for the protagonist before she became his sister which I felt made much more sense.


What surprised me the most about this anime was that their was actual plot in this series, mainly concerning around the triplets who I just adore. Their were some series moments in this show as well. Which were extremely heartfelt and OMG that squirrel too cute ♥


It's a nice little reverse harem that is filled with in my opinion pure enjoyment. The boys are beautiful and are great for any fangirl needing something to brighten up her day.


I give props to this series for after 12 episodes, not putting her in a relationship. It felt right but that doesn't mean the boys wont's stop loving her :)

Brothers Conflict is a difficult anime to review, as though it is by no means critically astounding, with a mediocre set of characters and faulty story-line, it is the perfect guilty pleasure for those seeking the ultimate reverse harem anime. Though the protagonist is overly-obliging and personality-less, this can be overlooked by the fact there are swarms of hot new 'brothers' about infatuated by her. The art and sound are also well done, as may be expected for such a recent anime. 
If you are looking for a deep anime with meaning thet will imprint your heart, here is not the place. But if youenjoy drama and romance with lots of enjoyment factor you may well find it!

This is definitely a fluffy guilty pleasure kind of anime. The animation is lovely, the voices are nice, the characters are all pretty adorable, and the plot is low-maintenance.
The main character is pretty standard for shoujo--sweet and cute, shy and a little naive--she's an independent teen who deals with her loneliness by honing her homemaker skills. All she really wants is to feel like part of a family, so when all her new step-brothers decide they want to be her boyfriend, she initially has no idea how to cope. Most of the plot is mini-arcs about each boy as she gets to know and lovethem, even if it's not the same way as they love her. 


If you want something simple with pretty boys and a surprisingly charming lead, watch this. 


If you're looking for genre subversion, groundbreaking stories, or a leading lady who wears her inner strength like armor, look elsewhere.

13  Boys. 1 Girl. 
When I first saw this anime, I wondered to myself, "Is this going to be a good idea?"
Story 3/10
The story is as bare-bones as you can get. Ema, the main protagonist, moves into  her new mother's house before the wedding between the new mother and her father.In the house, she meets her 13 step brothers and each one develops a crush on her throughout the series. 
While the plot can be explained in a matter of sentences, this anime focused more on the development of each brother and how they develop feelings for Ema. I really enjoyed this "slice-of-life"harem aspect to the anime even if there wasn't an overall narrative. 


Sound 8/10 

The sound of brothers conflict is amazing! The opening theme is incredibly catchy and I love how every brother has a different colored flower. The ending theme now one of my favorite endings in anime history because it is catchy, cute, and I always love to sing along with it. The dance the brothers do is awesome as well. 


Character 8/10 

The show focuses heavily on developing the brothers, which I felt this show did incredibly well. There's a different brother for every type of girl: Subaru, the sporty brother; Fuuto, the stubborn pop idol; The triplets, two of which are identical twins and voice actors and Natsume the game developer; Louis, the hairstylist who can understand animals; Kaname, the perverted monk; and so on. 

There's also a little squirrel named Juli who acts as Ema's guardian. I liked his character and loved how he always hissed and clawed the brothers. 

Ema herself is a very kindhearted girl who just wants to be part of the family. She's never had brothers before, and she enjoys learning about them and getting to know them. She is always nice and sweet, and the only part I don't like about her is she never makes mistakes. As a character, she is consistent, but we never see grow or change. This is perhaps most likely due to the fact she is supposed to be a kind of avatar for girls to picture themself as and live in the fantasy of having 13 brothers. 


Enjoyment 8/10 

I really enjoyed this anime. Every episode I was excited to see which brother we would get to learn more about and where Ema's life would lead. The only thing that's weird is that they are supposed to be her brothers and they like her....but I guess that's part of the fantasy. After all, with games like Fire Emblem Fates, Japan seems to have developed some kind of attachment to forbidden romance.


Overall 7/10 

This was pretty good for a reverse harem. If you enjoyed this anime, I would recommend Kagami no Asobi, a show that features 1 girl surrounded by 6 gods. It is more plot oriented than Brothers Conflict, but it is good for someone thirsting for more. 


Thank you for reading!

Kiss, kiss, kiss, I need your love!! 
This anime was super fun to watch! I especially enjoyed the music for the opening and ending themes, they always made me so happy! 
The originality in all the characters amazed me. The fact that each brother was completely different from the next was amazing. I had no problems learning all their names and being able to tell who was who when a name was mentioned. 
What really made this show enjoyable was how Ema wasn't jumping all over the boys like female leads have done in the past. I love how she was a "go with the flow" kind ofcharacter. She didn't exactly accept the love from her step brothers, but she also didn't flat out reject them either. Her calm manner when handling her brothers was what won me over.  \n

"Blood is not important, it's the heart that connects" -Louis
This anime i believe, aired off in 2013 and has a special plus 2 Ovas to be released on Christmas 2014 and on Valentines day 2015. 
The story starts with a beautiful lady named Ema setting to live with 13 step-brothers who has different contrasting personalities. This is a Harem, so i don't need to explain the romance elements as they were well thought out. Days go by and the charas get close and things get heated. 
Story: It was interesting from the start, there were many developments, many characters and many plot twists. However therewere some controversial elements, but since every Harem has that, it became a naturally settled in the end. What i noticed especially is that even though they are 12 (excluding the youngest son) not all of them had romantic interest towards the lady. Which makes it an added change. 


Art: Is absolutely Beautiful. Not a single complaint is there.Justice has been done to every character even the squirrel. Opening and Ending was done thoughtfully. 


Sound: The Opening and Ending music is very good, however even thought the background music section had some interesting pieces, i noticed that some of them were played at the wrong time, simply meaning that some of them were unsuitable to the required situation. 


Character: The limelight of the anime is the chara's different and unique personalities and how they conflict with the others. As there were 14 different people with different obsessions/age/interests/traits it was interesting to see how they got along each other. There were probably Yandere/Tsundere and you can probably even a whole collection of different deres for each of them. 


Enjoyment: I thoroughly enjoyed this, it has the required humor and the drama, the music was fine and the story was interesting, i desperately wished for more episodes. 


Overall: This anime is considered Reverse Harem, but has a different taste to it. If you are a fan of harems, this is a must-list for your collection, if you are an average watcher then excuse the congested lovey-dovey scenes and enjoy the uh plot!

This story is typical for reverse harems, much like Diabolic Lovers. It was basic and of course, you have your favorites, but I wish the female was a lot more outspoken in this anime. I enjoyed the art and the sound, music and voice actors, as it all fit with the anime. Characters are a bit basic, none really get the chance to fully fill out and so thats sad, because I felt that if I could have seen more of each guy, I would have really enjoyed it more. I still enjoyed the anime and of course I have my favorites, as anyone does.\n
Though, the most addicting thing about the anime is the ending sequence where the brothers sing and dance and it's addicting to watch over and over!

Brother's Conflict is a truly unique anime. Although I am quite a hater of rom-com and especially harem anime, this one CHANGED MY LIFE. I think that it is possibly one of the best that I have ever seen in my life. And also one of the shittiest. Why? Let's explore, shall we?
Story: We start with a cliche as fuck reverse harem theme. Some average chick winds up living with 13 hot guys. But what makes this story really unique? They are all her stepbrothers. And they all want to screw her. You get the idea. SO, by the sixth episode, half of them haveproclaimed their undying love for her, and have kissed her. I really love the fact that the heroine (Ema, Chii, I don't know, she wasn't that interesting) was so bland and emotionless. And the best part was how she kept just ignoring the fact that she could quite literally get raped at any time, AS SHE KEEPS OPENING THE DAMN DOOR TO THESE CREEPY-ASS STEPBROTHERS. One would think that, if some girl kept getting hit on by all these guys that she keeps not having any interest in, that she would tell them to, oh, I don't know, STOP KISSING HER. But she just takes it, and looks all blushy and stupid.


Art: The art was all right, actually pretty good.


Sound: Meh. The op and ed kinda pissed me off.


Character: Dear Lord, the characters. There was literally every single romance cliche guy in here. I didn't even bother remembering these boys names, just their cliches. For example, 'Pervy twin', 'Normal twin', 'Father Figure', and 'Probable sex offender'. If you watch the show, you know who I'm talking about.  My favorite character had to be the stoned looking brother (Luis) and the fucking squirrel. That damn thing was hilarious.  And sadly, was the smartest character in the show, which was probably why the boring protagonist didn't listen to it. Oh, and the okama brother. He was a ray of pure damn sunshine whenever he talked in this awful, awful show.


Enjoyment: A PERFECT 10/10. Why? Because this show was so bad, it became good. Every time that one of those freaks kissed her, I died laughing at her messed-up expression. And honestly, it takes me a full 45-60 min to watch one 20 minute episode. Mainly as I had to pause every few seconds to REACT to all the bullshit that was happening. I can't explain how much I anticipated episodes of this trash show. I derive nothing from it but pure JOY.


Overall: 10/10. This show is literally so terrible, all of your troubles will float away. And watch it dubbed. There's this one line; "Your school life will get 50 shades more exciting..." I cannot explain the tears of laughter when that was said.

I understand why many people don't like Brothers Conflict. The story is indeed a simple one, but does it have to be complicated to be enjoyeable? I don't think so, I loved this anime. It might be just a girl who moves in with her 13 brothers and the only thing that happens is that they fall in love with her, but the way that all these characters come forward is unique and has a certain charm. 
I for one wanted to marry half of them and wanted for the other half to be my real brothers! 
Each brother seemed like an actual individual, bythe end of the anime I had the feeling that they were real people that I had known for years.\n
The only thing I didn't quite like was the main character Ema. She wasn't actually present troughout the story even though she is the main character. I thought it a pity that she was kind of just being there like a liveless plant. Like she wasn't even alive. That made some moments a little annoying, but on the other hand it made me more engaged in the story. I was often screaming at her, telling her to stand up for herself!\n\n
As for the art, I think it was done very well. The brothers were seriously handsome, I didn't just have to assume they were. \n\n
Yet this is an anime that you either love or hate. You'll have to watch it for yourself to know wheter it's good or not, but I would recommend it!

Okay before hand i'm just going to say I am just a sucker for reverse harems(Probably the reason I stuck with it) and even when I say I prefer darker characters I enjoy things as fluffy and cute as this at times. This anime is one when your feelings aren't always the black and white,  I'd say its more likely you'll feel somewhere in between when it comes to this one. 
Story(5) - Yes it is a typical one girl, multiple guys living together sort of thing, you've probably seen this on wattpad and fanfiction hundreds of times! Yes the plot is sort ofblah, and I can understand what people are saying when they say it's completely unbelievable. I don't disagree with them because really it is, I mean what do you expect it was based off an Otome Game and some of those things are pretty sketchy. But really it wasn't that bad, it just wasn't that good if you get what I'm saying. For me it was just something to watch because I had heard things about. 


Art(6) - What do you want me to say? Once again this art was sort of blah blending in with the mainstream of today, but it's not like you looked at it and  cringed. It's just your everyday mainstream anime style and once again isn't that bad isn't that good. If you're one of those people who appreciate/prefer/want really unique good artwork, the content isn't good enough for you to overlook the blah art. Not to say you won't like it but if you're looking specifically for really nice/different art  you'll probably want to look somewhere else.


Sound(5) - Um let's compare the songs to when you have a food that has no nutritional value and tastes blah almost to the extent of being gross, but you can't stop stop eating it, it's just that addicting. I found the same thing with the music of Brothers Conflict. The opening was in one word...meh, I can't really say much about it other than that. As I say this again it wasn't that bad, but it wasn't that good the song. Although this song is leaning towards the bad side this time, it was still fine and I find it better than the ending despite me finding guilty pleasure in watching the ending multiple times... Well moving on to the latter, yes I did find some guilty pleasure in watching and hearing the song. The set up was awesome and creative, the lyrics were fine since I couldn't understand them unless I looked at the subtitles that were in every other episode, but the voices... Ugh. For example Yusuke who started us off with a  wonderful example of how not only did the family have flaws, but that some people are better left unheard. Despite the voices being all over the place, it was a cute set up. So close to ending this evaluation of sound one teensy weensy little thing about the voice acting, I could not handle Wataru's voice no matter how hard I tried to ignore it. It was just ugh...


Character(6) - Yes a six, a six despite the choppy cookie cutter personalities of the guys, despite me hating naive characters and how despite that watched twelve episodes of a single girl's stupidity. Yes I gave it a six because the brothers had a sense of diversity to them, because each one had an a extremely different personality. Some people might find that annoying that there were this many characters with all these different  personalities, but I'm amazed the people creating this could keep it all straight. I don't think there was single moment when I thought that the personalities were mixing together. Plus the fact that all the different personalities could create these different moments in nice to see, despite the feeling that they didn't work the angle as well as they could have it was still pretty good. Now that's the brothers, the so called heroine is a different story. The ponytail and face fit her personality perfectly and I absolutely hated that. Not that it fit perfectly, but her character. I just can't see how she can be that stupid throughout this entire thing, heck how'd her dad leave his supposedly cute yet enormously stupid, naive daughter in a house full of teenage/young adult boys!?


Enjoyment(6) - Two words, Guilty Pleasure, that's all I can say about this anime. Well obviously not all I can say about it, but that basically sums up my enjoyment of it. Adding to the fact I hadn't seen anime in a while (Just got off my mostly manga phase), much less a fluffy reverse harem (I was sticking to more fighter ones) one that's probably the reason I liked it as much as I did. Not to say no one else will like love this like teenage girls loved 1D and JB, but it's probably more likely to be a guilty pleasure. 


Well that's it for this one and really as one last thing I'm just going to say I feel like this anime could of been so much better with it's potential, but it just kinda fizzled instead of becoming what it could of been. That's just my opinion though so, yeah.

This anime is a reversed harem, but I think it could have been a lot better if it wasn't that. I find the characters to be very interesting and I'd like to know more about them. The family theme and how Ema feels about all of this is what I liked the most about this anime. It's just too bas that they had to include love into it, because I think it ruins the family aspect. I know it is based on a visual novel thus is a romance, but still.
Other than that, if you liked reversed harems, you'll like it. It is enjoyable towatch, and there are some nice funny moments too. Most characters get some development which is quite nice. If you don't like harems, I would pass on that.

Synopsis:
Hinata Ema is the only daughter of a famous adventurer, Hinata Rintarou. One day, Ema learns that Rintarou is going to remarry with a successful apparel maker named Asahina Miwa. Since she doesn't want to disturb them, Ema decides to move out and live with her 13 new brothers in a mansion called Sunrise Residence. As they live under the same roof, romance is starting to grow between Ema and the Asahina brothers.
------
So the story was all about Ema (also called as Chii) who had a reverse harem for herself. Of course I was curious of how things will end. Like "who will she endup with" "how will they sort out their relationship". The plot has nothing much to expect. But because of my curiosity of what may happen, I watched it. As a reverse harem/shoujo anime, It is well made, very good, that it's not obvious of who'll she'll choose and end up with. And as a girl, this anime tickled my girl side-- It got me interested, added that those 13 brothers are all good looking.


Ema is a simple girl. I really like the part of her that she's not a crybaby. We all know that in most shoujo manga/ anime, that if the heroine is being teased, she'll cry (stupid, right? -_- ) Good thing about Ema that she's strong enough not to cry for simple reasons. But she's too quiet. It really bothers me like how can she go on through the day like nothing happened? I really don't get it why Ema doesn't say anything. She just lets them do things with her, like it's okay since they're family? (wtf)


"Brothers Conflict" gave each and everyone chances to be with the heroine (to make the watchers think more of who'll she'll end up with), and that's good. But the thing is.. the heroine didn't establish any strong bond with anyone since the anime jumps from a brother to another every episode.

So none of their pasts were really highlighted.. but it's really fine. I think their pasts don't have to do with anything, so nothing much was included. Eventually you'll understand each and everyone's attitude and personalities.

But isn't it confusing that none of those good looking brothers have girlfriends? lol that's reverse harem for you


The characters, the landscape, the background.. all of them were well-drawn! To be honest, I got hooked by their looks rather than the plot.


The anime doesn't really have interesting storyline. It was just all about "who'll she end up with", really. There is no twist that got me excited but still, I kept on watching because the 'curiosity' drives me to.


 I love how the author made this anime with good looking guys. It made the watchers root for their own choices.


 People who like reverse harem and shoujo/ romance genre, "Brothers Conflict" may just fit the spot.

A big fan of reverse harems, having a rare anime which had that as a theme was exciting for me. However, watching this anime made me laugh at the ridiculous and emotionless heroine, and cringe at her actions.
Our little protagonist Chi, may be the worst protag i have ever had to watch. Her emotions are completely bland, even her smiling feels cold and with no feeling, her dialogue also consists in "um...I.. , sorry, it's okay!, we are siblings." and I can go on and on...
The plot is of no interest, I always play a game on the side when I watch it, and rarelyeven read the translations. \n\n
I guess the only good side of this anime would be the character designs and the music, and the cheap, cute and totally consented romantic scenes between Chi and her brothers. (sarcasm level over 9000)\n\n
Overall, this anime is something to look at when you're bored, enjoy bishies and random cute scenes, or simply laughing at the emotions of Chi and suffer with that annoying pet she neglects so much.

This was actually the very first anime I ever saw. I saw its promo in my television and that's when i decided 'I HAVE TO WATCH THIS THING!!'
A typical reverse harem

A cute girl
chased by not 1,2,3 or 4 but almost 9-10 really HOT guys

what could be more uncomfortable for a girl who didn't have romance in her life till now and suddenly one day 10 guys are fighting for her!!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~LOVE IT~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
It would have been better if Ema would have chosen someone in the end. But SADLY she just kept saying 'You all are my brothers and Ilove you all'\n
That broke my heart :((

Brothers Conflict in a word: Typical
The best thing about this anime is the End Credits song (so catchy!). Yes, I did enjoy it, but that's just because I love reverse harem animes. As an anime overall, it's not very good. Story, characters, and animation are all weak.
The boys are beautiful. So if that's all you're looking for, forget reading reviews and just go watch it!
My biggest complain with this anime (as with most reverse harems) is that the main girl is an idiot! Hinata is very bland and ignorant. Pretty much the only thing that makes her different from Haruka in Uta no Prince Sama,Yui in Diabolic Lovers, Heroine in Amnesia, and Ritsuka in Dances with Devils is that she likes videos games. Other than that, all five of these female leads are basically the same person. Apparently girls surrounded by hawt men are instantly dumbstruck and robbed of any common sense. It would be nice to see a reverse harem anime where the female lead isn't so clueless!\n\n

This anime is okay if you don't take it too seriously. I mean, it's a reverse harem with 13 stepbrothers with not even enough episodes for each of them. I didn't expect much and it gave me a few good laughs and light entertainment.
It's fun to watch if you're looking for a reverse harem with lots of bishounen with a shallow plot. The girl isn't too annoying but she doesn't have any redeeming qualities either and is a bit too complacent for my taste.
I think the saving grace of this anime is its art. The character designs are actually quite nice and each of theguys are easily distinguishable from one another. The animation is also surprisingly clean and fluid with nice settings.
